      function OptanonWrapper() {
        var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
        const id = user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id();
        const firstName = user.first_name;
        const lastName = user.last_name;
        let targetingCookieValue;
        let dnpValue;
        const dataLayer = window.dataLayer;
        const GroupsArr = dataLayer?.filter((item) => item.event === 'OneTrustGroupsUpdated');
        console.log(window.dataLayer);
        if (GroupsArr?.length > 1) {
          const previousCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 2]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          let FunctionalCategoryChanged;
          let TargetingCategoryChanged;
          const previousCLC003Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          const updatedCLC003Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          if (previousCLC003Exist && !updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = true;
          } else if (!previousCLC003Exist && updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = false;
          } else {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          const previousCLC004Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          const updatedCLC004Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          if (previousCLC004Exist && !updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'NO';
          } else if (!previousCLC004Exist && updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'YES';
          } else {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          if (FunctionalCategoryChanged) {
            callDNP(id, dnpValue, user.session);
          } else if (updatedCLC003Exist) {
            console.log('0003 on');
            initializePendo();
          }
          if (TargetingCategoryChanged) {
            /* this timeout is added because Pendo allows only one API call per second per visitor */
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(id, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
            }, 2000);
          }

        } else if (GroupsArr?.length === 1) {
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          dnpValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') === -1;
          targetingCookieValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') === -1 ? 'NO' : 'YES';
          createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, id, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
        }
      };

    function createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, visitorId, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo create visitor');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/createVisistor', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify([{
          visitorId,
          values: {
            firstname: firstName,
            lastname: lastName
          }
        }])
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (response.status === 200) {
            callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid);
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid);
            }, 2000);
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid) {
      const params = {
        'visitorId': visitorId,
        'dnpValue': dnpValue
      };
      console.log('pendo callDNP');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/dnp', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (!dnpValue) {
            window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].startGuides();
            initializePendo();
          } else {
             window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].stopGuides();
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function getHeader(sid) {
      const headers = new Headers();
      headers.append('Content-Type', 'application/json');
      headers.append('SID', sid);
      return headers;
    }

    function initializePendo() {
      console.log('pendo initialize');
      var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
      window.pendo.initialize({
        visitor: {
          id: user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id(),
          truid: user.truid,
          email: user.email,
          full_name: user.full_name,
          session: user.session,
          sp: user.sp,
          interface_language: user.lang,
          entitlements: user.entitlements
        },
        account: {
          id: user.customerId,
          name: user.name,
          environment: user.environment
        }
      });
    }

    function updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo update Target');
      const params = {
        'targetingCookieValue': targetingCookieValue,
        'visitorId': visitorId,
      };
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/updateMetaData', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }</script><style>.section-with-left-nav header{display:flex;justify-content:center;margin:0 .9375rem}.section-with-left-nav header Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0034-4885&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=REPORTS ON PROGRESS IN PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-251-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-251-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 78 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec251AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>In this review we look at the concepts and state-of-the-art concerning the strong coupling of surface plasmon-polariton modes to states associated with <mark>quantum</mark> emitters such as excitons in J-aggregates, dye molecules and <mark>quantum</mark> dots. We explore the phenomenon of strong coupling with reference to a number of examples involving electromagnetic fields and matter. We then provide a concise descrip</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1530-6984&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-252-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-252-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 14 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.2884-2889 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec252AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Newly fabricated few-layer black phosphorus and its monolayer structure, phosphorene, are expected to be promising for electronic and optical applications because of their finite direct band gaps and sizable but anisotropic electronic mobility. By first-principles simulations, we show that this unique anisotropic free-carrier mobility can be controlled by using simple strain conditions. With th</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2058-8437&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE REVIEWS MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-253-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-253-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 5 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.423-439 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec253AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Hybrid organic-inorganic perovskites (HOIPs) offer long carrier-diffusion lengths, high absorption coefficients, tunable band gaps and long spin lifetimes. The flexible crystal structure and ionic nature of HOIPs make it possible to allow tuning of their material properties through rational design, including the incorporation of chiral organic ligands. Recently, chiral HOIPs have emerged as pro</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0003-6951&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-254-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-254-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 102 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec254AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The band offsets and heterostructures of monolayer and few-layer transition-metal dichalcogenides MX2 (M = Mo, W; X = S, Se, Te) are investigated from first principles calculations. The band alignments between different MX2 monolayers are calculated using the vacuum level as reference, and a simple model is proposed to explain the observed chemical trends. Some of the monolayers and their heter</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-256-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-256-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-256-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-256-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 14 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.826-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec256AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Thin layers of black phosphorus have recently raised interest owing to their two-dimensional (2D) semiconducting properties, such as tunable direct bandgap and high carrier mobilities. This lamellar crystal of phosphorus atoms can be exfoliated down to monolayer 2D-phosphane (also called phosphorene) using procedures similar to those used for graphene. Probing the properties has, however, been </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-257-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-257-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1616-301X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-257-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-257-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 24 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (46) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.7373-7380 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec257AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Organolead halide perovskites have attracted extensive attentions as light harvesting materials for solar cells recently, because of its high charge-carrier mobilities, high photoconversion efficiencies, low energy cost, ease of deposition, and so on. Herein, with CH3NH3PbI3 film deposited on flexible ITO coated substrate, the first organolead halide perovskite based broadband photodetector is </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1463-9076&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY CHEMICAL PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-259-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-259-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 11 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (46) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.10757-10816 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec259AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We introduce density functional theory and review recent progress in its application to transition metal chemistry. Topics covered include local, meta, hybrid, hybrid meta, and range-separated functionals, band theory, software, validation tests, and applications to spin states, magnetic exchange coupling, spectra, structure, reactivity, and catalysis, including molecules, clusters, nanoparticl</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-260-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-260-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-260-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-260-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 30 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (40) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec260AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The electrochemical reduction of N-2 into NH3 production under ambient conditions represents an attractive prospect for the fixation of N-2. However, this process suffers from low yield rate of NH3 over reported electrocatalysts. In this work, a record-high activity for N-2 electrochemical reduction over Ru single atoms distributed on nitrogen-doped carbon (Ru SAs/N-C) is reported. At -0.2 V ve</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-261-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-261-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0009-2665&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=CHEMICAL REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-261-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-261-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 117 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (20) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.12584-12640 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec261AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>DNA has become one of the most extensively used molecular building blocks for engineering self-assembling materials. DNA origami is a technique that uses hundreds of short DNA oligonucleotides, called staple strands, to fold a long single stranded DNA, which is called a scaffold strand, into various designer nanoscale architectures. DNA origami has dramatically improved the complexity and scala</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-262-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-262-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0256-307X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=CHINESE PHYSICS LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-262-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-262-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 29 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec262AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We report high transition temperature superconductivity in one unit-cell (UC) thick FeSe films grown on a Se-etched SrTiO3(001) substrate by molecular beam epitaxy (MBE). A superconducting gap as large as 20 meV and the magnetic field induced vortex state revealed by in situ scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) suggest that the superconductivity of the 1 UC FeSe films could occur around 77 K. Th</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="value ng-star-inserted"><td _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-263-JCI-category-name_0" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-263-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-263-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0036-8075&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SCIENCE" data-ta="Sidenav-263-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-263-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 329 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5987) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.61-64 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec263AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The anomalous Hall effect is a fundamental transport process in solids arising from the spin-orbit coupling. In a <mark>quantum</mark> anomalous Hall insulator, spontaneous magnetic moments and spin-orbit coupling combine to give rise to a topologically nontrivial electronic structure, leading to the quantized Hall effect without an external magnetic field. Based on first-principles calculations, we predict</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record263">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-264-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-264-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-264-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-264-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 139 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (22) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.7586-7594 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec264AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The effect of defects on electron-hole separation is not always clear and is sometimes contradictory. Herein, we initially built clear models of two-dimensional atomic layers with tunable defect concentrations, and hence directly disclose the defect type and distribution at atomic level. As a prototype, defective one-unit-cell ZnIn2S4 atomic layers are successfully synthesized for the first tim</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2211-2855&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO ENERGY" data-ta="Sidenav-265-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-265-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 12 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.646-656 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec265AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Efficient charge separation and broaden light absorption are of crucial importance for solar-driven hydrogen evolution reaction (HER), and graphitic carbon nitride (g-C3N4) is a very promising photocatalyst for this reaction. Here we report a facile precursor pre-treatment method, by forming hydrogen bond-induced supramolecular aggregates, to fabricate g-C3N4 with simultaneous novel porous netw</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2041-1723&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE COMMUNICATIONS" data-ta="Sidenav-266-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-266-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 3 </span><!----><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec266AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>A two-dimensional honeycomb lattice harbours a pair of inequivalent valleys in the k-space electronic structure, in the vicinities of the vertices of a hexagonal Brillouin zone, K-+/-. It is particularly appealing to exploit this emergent degree of freedom of charge carriers, in what is termed 'valleytronics'. The <mark>physics</mark> of valleys mimics that of spin, and will make possible devices, analogous</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-267-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-267-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.923-930 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec267AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The monolayer transition metal dichalcogenides have recently attracted much attention owing to their potential in valleytronics, flexible and low-power electronics, and optoelectronic devices. Recent reports have demonstrated the growth of large-size two-dimensional MoS2 layers by the sulfurization of molybdenum oxides. However, the growth of a transition metal selenide monolayer has still been</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1433-7851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ANGEWANDTE CHEMIE-INTERNATIONAL EDITION" data-ta="Sidenav-268-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-268-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 57 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (21) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.6054-6059 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec268AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>As electron transfer to CO2 is generally considered to be the critical step during the activation of CO2, it is important to develop approaches to engineer the electronic properties of catalysts to improve their performance in CO2 electrochemical reduction. Herein, we developed an efficient strategy to facilitate CO2 activation by introducing oxygen vacancies into electrocatalysts with electron</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="cdk-visually-hidden"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">Journal Citation Indicator Summary</span></caption><tr _ngcontent-krm-c256=""><th _ngcontent-krm-c256="" id="Sidenav-269-JCI-category-quartile">Category Quartile </th></tr><tr _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="value ng-star-inserted"><!----><!----><!----></tr><!----></table><div _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-269-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-269-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1098-0121&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW B" data-ta="Sidenav-269-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-269-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 83 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (20) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec269AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We investigate novel phases that emerge from the interplay of electron correlations and strong spin-orbit interactions. We focus on describing the topological semimetal, a three-dimensional phase of a magnetic solid, and argue that it may be realized in a class of pyrochlore iridates (such as Y(2)Ir(2)O(7)) based on calculations using the LDA + U method. This state is a three-dimensional analog</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record269">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" data-wos-id="colluid_WOS:000290120500002"></div><app-summary-record-links class=""><a cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_Links" cdxanalyticsvalue="1" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-270-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-270-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-270-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-270-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 382 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6592) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.609-611 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec270AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>PATTERNING matter on the nanometre scale is an important objective of current materials chemistry and <mark>physics</mark>. It is driven by both the need to further miniaturize electronic components and the fact that at the nanometre scale, materials properties are strongly size-dependent and thus can be tuned sensitively(1). In nanoscale crystals, <mark>quantum</mark> size effects and the large number of surface atoms </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2574-0970&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS APPLIED NANO MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-271-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-271-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 3 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.8004-8011 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec271AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Herein, we fabricated nanoparticles of doped carbon dots with nitrogen (N-CDs) with an ecofriendly and easy approach, yielding spherical nanoparticles (mean size: 19 nm). N-CDs were further characterized by high-resolution transmission electron microscopy, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, and fluorescence spectroscopy. In addition, we developed a fluorometric method for determination of dopami</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" The results obtained for structural, thermodynamic, kinetic and spectroscopic (magnetic, infrared and electronic! properties are satisfactory and not far from those delivered by the most Boron analogues have been predicted, as boron atoms possess a short covalent radius and the flexibility to adopt sp(2) hybridization, features that favour the formation of two-dimensional allotropes, and one example of such a borophene m</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-274-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-274-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 437 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7059) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.671-679 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec274AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The fabrication methods of the microelectronics industry have been refined to produce ever smaller devices, but will soon reach their fundamental limits. A promising alternative route to even smaller functional systems with nanometre dimensions is the autonomous ordering and assembly of atoms and molecules on atomically well-defined surfaces. This approach combines ease of fabrication with exqu</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-275-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-275-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 230 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.269-303 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec275AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Photonic crystals have been established as unique periodic structures to promote photon capture and control over light-matter interactions. Their application in semiconductor, mainly TiO2, photocatalysis has emerged as a promising structural modification to boost light harvesting of photocatalytic materials by means of slow photons i.e. light propagation at reduced group velocity near the edges</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button Here we present the rational design, synthesis, and characterization of a new class of core shell upconversion nanoparticles displaying unprecedented optical properties. Specifically, we show</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-277-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-277-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1530-6984&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-277-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-277-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 17 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (12) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.8005-8011 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec277AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Cesium lead halide (CsPbX3) perovskite nanocrystals (NCs) have demonstrated extremely excellent optical properties and great application potentials in various optoelectronic devices. However, because of the anion exchange, it is difficult to achieve white-light and multicolor emission for practical applications. Herein, we present the successful doping of various lanthanide ions (Ce3+, Sm3+, Eu</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-278-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-278-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 210 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.45-56 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec278AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Special enhanced synergetic effect of MoS2 <mark>quantum</mark> dots (MoS2 QDs) and graphene on metal-organic frameworks for photocatalytic hydrogen evolution is obtained here. The photocatalytic activity of H-2 evolution reach 186.37 mu mol over the EY-sensitized 5 rift% MoS2 QDs/UiO-66-NH2/G irradiated under visible light irradiation (lambda &gt;= 420nm) in the first 3 h, and the apparent <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Defect passivation using organic molecules has been identified as an attractive approach to tackle this issue. However, implementation of this approach has been hindered by a lack of deep understanding of how the molecular structures influe</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span Depending on the material they consist of, nanoparticles can possess a number of different properties such as high electron density and strong optical absorption (e.g. metal particles, in particular Au), photoluminescence in the form of fluorescence (semiconductor <mark>quantum</mark> do</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1616-301X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-283-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-283-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 28 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (51) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec283AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Developing active, robust, and nonprecious electrocatalysts for the hydrogen evolution reaction (HER), oxygen evolution reaction (OER), and oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) is highly crucial and challenging. In this work, a facile strategy is developed for scalable fabrication of dicobalt phosphide (Co2P)-cobalt nitride (CoN) core-shell nanoparticles with double active sites encapsulated in nitr</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-285-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-285-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 13 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.411-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec285AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Exploring the interaction between two neighbouring monomers has great potential to significantly raise the performance and deepen the mechanistic understanding of heterogeneous catalysis. Herein, we demonstrate that the synergetic interaction between neighbouring Pt monomers on MoS2 greatly enhanced the CO2 hydrogenation catalytic activity and reduced the activation energy relative to isolated </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-286-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-286-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0167-5729&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SURFACE SCIENCE REPORTS" data-ta="Sidenav-286-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-286-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 66 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1-27 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec286AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Kelvin probe force microscopy (KPFM) is a tool that enables nanometer-scale imaging of the surface potential on a broad range of materials. KPFM measurements require an understanding of both the details of the instruments and the <mark>physics</mark> of the measurements to obtain optimal results. The first part of this review will introduce the principles of KPFM and compare KPFM to other surface work funct</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-287-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-287-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-287-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-287-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 496 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7444) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.196-200 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec287AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Topological insulators are a new phase of matter(1), with the striking property that conduction of electrons occurs only on their surfaces(1-3). In two dimensions, electrons on the surface of a topological insulator are not scattered despite defects and disorder, providing robustness akin to that of superconductors. Topological insulators are predicted to have wide-ranging applications in fault</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record287">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-krm-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0935-9648&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-289-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-289-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-krm-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-krm-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 32 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (33) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec289AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Establishing highly effective charge transfer channels in carbon nitride (C3N4) for enhancing its photocatalytic activity is still a challenging issue. Herein, for the first time, the engineering of C(3)N(4)layers with single-atom Cu bonded with compositional N (Cu-N-x) is demonstrated to address this challenge. The Cu-N(x)is formed by intercalation of chlorophyll sodium copper salt into a mela</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" Full use of singlet and triplet excitons, electrophosphorescence, has attracted increasing attentions after the premier work made by Forrest, Thompson, and co-workers. In fact, red electrophosphorescent dye has already been used in sub-display of commercial mob</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper
